text: ان الله هو الرزاق ذو القوة المتين

translations.translation: Truly Allah, He is the Provider, the Possessor of Strength, the Sure.
God is certainly the great provider, Lord of strength and power.
Surely Allah is the Bestower of all provision, the Lord of all power, the Strong.
It is God Who is the Sustainer and the Lord of invincible strength.
Indeed it is Allah, Who is the Greatest Sustainer, the Strong, the Able.
Verily, Allah is the All-Provider, Owner of power, the Most Strong.
Surely Allah is the Bestower of sustenance, the Lord of Power, the Strong.
Surely God is the All-provider, the Possessor of Strength, the Ever-Sure.
Lo! Allah! He it is that giveth livelihood, the Lord of unbreakable might.
it is God who is the great Sustainer, the Mighty One, the Invincible.
Verily Allah! He is the Provider, Owner of power, Firm.
Indeed it is Allah who is the All-provider, Powerful and All-strong.
For Allah is He Who gives (all) Sustenance,- Lord of Power,- Steadfast (for ever).
Verily, Allah is the All-Provider, Owner of Power, the Most Strong.
Surely, Allah is the Provider, the Possessor of Power, the Mighty.
God is the Provider, the One with Power, the Strong.
Indeed, it is Allah who is the [continual] Provider, the firm possessor of strength.
[51:58] Indeed it is God Who is the Provider, the Lord of Strength, the Firm, the Stern.
(Lo! Allah! He it is that giveth livelihood) to His slaves, (the Lord of unbreakable might) against His enemies, Who has in store a severe chastisement for them.

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: وكيف أريد منهم أمثال هذا { إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ } المتوحد بالأوهية والربوبية { هُوَ ٱلرَّزَّاقُ } المنحصر المخوص في ترزيق عموم العباد، لا رازق لهم سواه { ذُو ٱلْقُوَّةِ ٱلْمَتِينُ } [الذاريات: 58] والطول العظيم المقتدر الحاكم، الغالب على عموم مراداته ومقدوراته على وجه الإحكام من الإنعام والانتقام

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text:
{ إِنَّ الله هو الرزَّاق } أي: يرزق كل مَن يفتقر إلى الرزق، وفيه تلويح بأنه غني عنه، { ذو القوة } ذو الاقتدار، { المتينُ } أي: الشديد الصلب
 وقرأ الأعمش " المتِين " بالجر، نعت للقوة، أي: ذو القوة المتينة، وإنما ذكّره لتأول القوة بالاقتدار
